commit.message:
Process exit status messages using background awk scripts

New Features

* '-x' option enables custom status script
* Status path is defined by ENTR_STATUS_SCRIPT (default path is
  $HOME/.entr/status.awk)
* Example status scripted created if it does not exist
* Abort if the status process terminates for any reason

Message Format

  exit_type exit_code utility_name

Changes to Existing Behavior

* shell (-s) option no longer prints a status by default

Caveats

* Not compatible with restart (-r) option
* gawk required on Alpine, or use '-xx' to allow unsafe operation

Use min(OPEN_MAX, rl.rlim_max) to set rlim_cur on MacOS

Based on the man page for setrlimit(2); kern.maxfilesperproc may not
represent the hard limit for a process.

Output all test file contents if system test fails

To make it easy to debug a failing system_test.sh run on any CI system
output contents of all test files, including the standard output and error
contents of the previous command.
Use int32_t for max_open and set EV_TRACE for make test

Adapt system test to ash(1)

Also remove sleep statement in setup()

Use waitpid() to monitor utility status

Calling wait(2) indiscriminately prevents entr from using fork/exec to
launch "sidecar" processes.

Use a more modular build

Create a compat library and build each .so before linking the final
binary.

Misc typos

This has been as a patch in Debian for a while and should be fixed upstream
instead: https://sources.debian.org/src/entr/5.5-1/debian/patches/fix-spelling.patch/

Set _GNU_SOURCE

This is set implicitly by some compiler invocations.

Respect $CC as the Makefile does
Detect and use native strlcpy(3) on Linux
Prepare 5.5 release and drop versioncheck target
Only include sys/sysctl.h on MacOS
Use kern.maxfilesperproc to determine file open limit on MacOS
Report correct error if open(3) fails
Minor formatting adjustments
5.4 release
system tests: catch ^C and display line number
Remove inotify/kqueue links from README.md

Reorganize configure script

- warn for arguments that are not recognized
- only print help if -h is specified
Add TARGET_OS configuration option

Minor adjustments to functions called by signal handlers

Drop comments that are well-documented in previous commit messages
Neaten up Makefile

print_child_status: make function (mostly) signal safe

fprintf, getenv and basename are not async-signal-safe. so instead:

* cache the value of $SHELL to a variable to avoid calling getenv()
* do similar thing for `shell_base` to avoid calling basename()
* use snprintf() + write() instead of fprintf()

write() is async-signal-safe, but snprintf isn't. but it should work out
in practice.

use _exit() inside signal-handlers

`exit` is not async-signal-safe, `_exit` is.
see signal-safety(7) manpage.

additionally add a note about killpg.

proc_exit: restore errno before leaving

otherwise, an errno set by any of the functions called in the
signal-handler might clobber the errno value for the resuming code and
lead to unintended consqeuences.
News: maxfiles is assumed to be unlimted on MacOS
Try to increase open file limit on macOS

Revert "Move WatchFile struct to main source file"

This reverts commit f9ac92d17e42236fe6b5e8492e087620173c7b24.

Used for inotify support
Sync the README with the man page examples

commit.message: Move WatchFile struct to main source file
